intro: Sageretia elegans, commonly known as the elegant sageretia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Sageretia elegans produces small, yellowish to white flowers that bloom in the summer months.
